results.title: Alexander and the terrible, horrible, no good, very bad day (K)
results.brief_description: Anyone can have a bad day, but no one wants to have one quite as awful as seven year old Alexander’s. Whether it’s his mother forgetting to pack dessert in his lunch, or the dentist discovering he has a new cavity, nothing goes right for Alexander from sun-up to sun-down. Alexander will not only win children’s sympathy, he’ll remind the child in every adult how those little tragedies can accumulate to make an otherwise normal day seem like a catastrophe. Based on the best selling children’s book by Judith Viorst.

results.title: Alexander and the car with a missing headlight
results.creator_credit: Institut für Film und Bild, Weston Woods Studios, Peter Fleischmann and Cynthia Freitag
results.brief_description: Released by the Weston Woods Studios in 1966 and English language version directed by Cynthia Freitag. A fantasy about a small boy’s adventures as he drives around the world in an old car. Pictures, sound effects and narrative comments are by children of different nations. From the book by Peter Fleischmann and Morton Schindel. Suitable for lower primary level.

results.title: Alex the talking chimp
results.brief_description: This is a story about Sidney Martin’s Carnival, a small-time carnival in small-town America. Sidney’s carnival is going through bad times and a feud between Kirk the Animal Trainer and Markov the Magnificent over Kirk’s inhumane treatment of the animals doesn’t make things any easier. Markov is fired, but unbeknownst to Sidney and the rest of the carnival workers, Markov has a secret weapon in the form of a talking chimp called Alex. Can Alex save the day? Will Markov, who is totally against the exploitation of animals, let Alex perform alongside him in order to keep his job? Experience the magic of a carnival and see what it’s like behind the scenes - the people, the relationships, the problems, the good times and the bad times. Cast includes Jennifer Houlton, Howard Segal, Mark Weston and Trudi the chimp.

results.title: Alex
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Erna Buffie, Wolf Koenig and Brian Dooley
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Wednesday’s children”.
A teenager attempts to cope after his parents have separated. His working mother is rarely at home when Alex is. Although his father seems inaccessible, Alex boasts to his friends about their closeness. Amid unbearable emotional confusion, Alex grabs a woman’s purse and is caught. One of a series of six short dramatic discussion starters for adolescents and adults on the subject of teenage alineation.

results.title: Alert!
results.brief_description: A series of incidents demonstrating the need for accident prevention. People on dangerous jobs are aware of the risks and keep their minds on their work, but passers-by and workers who are worried or inclined to day-dream, need to remember that nearly all accidents happen through thinking of something else. A quarter of all accidents happen through the job being done the wrong way; untidily, without safety devices or too fast. Film closes by re-emphasising the need to be constantly alert.

results.title: Aleph Null
results.brief_description: Aleph Null is color music. No audio. It’s an online, generative, interactive, open source visual work written in JavaScript using the HTML5 canvas tag.

constellations_other.name: Pen names, poems and puppets

results.title: Alcoholism
results.brief_description: The film portrays alcoholism as a mental health problem and as an illness that can respond to treatment. Demonstrates that the causes of this illness are imbedded personality difficulties often relating back to the early formative years of the victim’s childhood. The film discusses different forms of alcoholism and the different treatment required for each type. The role of Alcoholics Anonymous is covered and a plea made for increased public facilities for the treatment of alcoholics.

results.title: Alcohol: the problem with drinking
results.creator_credit: Tasmanian Film Corporation, Alcohol and Drug Dependency Board of Tasmania, Don Anderson and Sherry James
results.brief_description: The problem of teenage/adolescent drinking. Discusses some of the reasons why they drink, their attitude towards alcohol, and some problems associated with drinking. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: Alcohol: the first decision
results.creator_credit: King Screen Productions and Don Dickerson
results.brief_description: Surveys what young people are confronted with when deciding whether or not to drink, including seeing their parents drink, seeing advertisements for liquor in newspapers, magazines, and on billboards, and hearing alcoholism made a subject for levity on radio and television.
